title: How to Make a YouTube Channel for Beginners
headline: Learn how to create a YouTube channel and use it to market your brand or business in this free online course.
description: YouTube is one of the most popular websites in the world, with more than 2 billion users. Leverage this powerful video platform by enrolling in this free online How to Make a YouTube Channel for Beginners course. The step-by-step process includes everything from the initial creation, to recommended equipment and software, how to upload videos on YouTube Studio, design and upload YouTube channel art, optimize your channel, and monetize content.

Recognize how to grow, market and monetize your channel
courseDescription:
Online marketing is a critical part of the overall marketing plan and in modern times, YouTube should form a part of it. This course will teach you how to build a branded YouTube channel for marketing your business and will take you through the initial setup process where you will sign up for a YouTube account and create a channel after exploring terms, guidelines and policies to ensure that you operate within approved regulations. Customizing your YouTube channel can help your audience have a unique experience and you will learn all about how to create an attractive, professional homepage. YouTube studio is the backend of the platform and the next chapter explores how it works, how to set up your channel keywords, location, video watermark, and manage your YouTube account through the advanced settings section. This will give you an understanding of how to utilize certain features to link Google Adwords for promotions and add Google Analytics to enable you to track and analyze your channel traffic. Once your account is properly set up, the course will guide you through some of the available options for equipment and software to get you started with the creation and editing of videos.

Do you know that having a low-quality video can turn people away from engaging with your content? Having said that, how do you ensure your video content is of standard quality? This YouTube course will explore software that can be utilized for the purpose of presentation, recording and editing to achieve a standard video quality. Other equipment that adds to your video quality such as microphones, cameras, studio lighting and props will be explored. When you want to do a tutorial on your YouTube channel, what type of video recording comes to your mind? Screencast video or “talking head” video? This YouTube course will teach you all these video types, when to use them, which elements are necessary to create them and how they can effectively be combined to suit your message and/or audience. A channel trailer can be a very powerful tool to turn your visitors into subscribers and you will learn all the tips and tricks to create one including a call-to-action video outro. Now that you are done with your video editing, it's time to make it go live by uploading it to your channel. This course goes on to show you how to upload videos properly by using recommended settings for titles, descriptions and tags to keep the channel organized so that your content is easy for your target audience and customers to find. You will learn how to grow your channel with various video marketing methods to help you generate more clients, leads and sales. 

This YouTube marketing course is structured to reinforce learned material with well-crafted questions spread throughout its duration and a course assessment at the end of the course. This course is aimed at beginners who are interested in creating great YouTube content and an authentic, user-friendly channel. In order to enrol for this course, all you need is a computer, internet connection, passion and enthusiasm!

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to YouTube for business. You will start by signing up with Google and creating a channel. You will then learn how to work on features like channel artwork, description, AdWords and Google analytics. Different equipment and software options used in various video creation will be explored.
topics: Set Up and Content Creation - Learning Outcomes
Equipment and Software for Video Creation
Set Up and Content Creation - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn how to use created videos on the YouTube channel for marketing and Promotion. You will be shown how to upload and organize videos so they work well and rank properly. Also, you will be taught strategies for getting more subscribers, views and tracking analytics to boost sales performance.
topics: Uploading and Marketing Content - Learning Outcomes
Uploading and Marketing Content - Lesson Summary

topics: How To Make A YouTube Channel for Beginners - Course assessment

slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Analyze YouTube guidelines and policies.
    • Recall how to sign up with Google to create your YouTube account.
    • Describe how to set up your channel.
    • Discuss editing and recording software.
    • Describe audio and video equipment, studio lighting and background props.
    • Recall recommended settings for YouTub and various video recording basics.
    • Outline how to verify your YouTube account to enable you to upload long videos.
    • Discuss various video editing techniques.

  • Lesson Summary

  • The key points from this module are:
    • YouTube Content creators should take the time to understand terms, guidelines and policies.
    • YouTube's Terms and Policies may change over time so they should be reviewed periodically to avoid violation.
    • If you violate the YouTube terms, your channel can be removed and your account terminated.
    • Ensure the content you upload is your own or that you have the appropriate use authorization.
    • Three copyright strikes may result in your channel being terminated.
    • Some copyrighted material may result in a content-id claim where the original owner can receive revenue from the content or have the content taken down.
    • Videos can be monetized through the YouTube partnership program where you are paid based on ads displayed on your videos or any premium views that your videos receive.
    • To be eligible for the partnership program, your channel must have over four thousand hours of watch time over the previous 12 months and at least one thousand subscribers.
    • Ensure you only monetize original and advertisement-friendly content, avoiding topics like inappropriate language, violence, adult content, harmful or dangerous acts, hateful content, drug use, tobacco or firearms-related content, controversial issues, sensitive events, and adult themes and family content.

  • Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Explain how to properly upload videos to your YouTube channel.
    • Outline what needs to be done to help your videos rank well on YouTube so that they are easy to find.
    • Recognize how to organize your channel.
    • List tips for growing your YouTube channel.
    • Discuss strategies to get more channel subscribers to your channel.
    • Identify ways to get more video views.
    • Analyze how to keep track of your channel analytics.
    • Recall video marketing strategies to help generate leads, clients and sales.
    • Describe the steps to take needed complete for sales funnel.

  • Lesson Summary

  • The key points from this module are:
    • In order to grow your channel people need to watch your videos.
    • To increase views create content relevant to your niche and optimize content during the upload process.
    • When uploading videos, create keyword-rich titles, descriptions and video tags to help your videos rank in YouTube and Google search engines.
    • Video Thumbnails are the first thing people see when scrolling through the YouTube search results so It is recommended to customize thumbnails to attract more attention.
    • Arranging videos in playlists allow users to easily search for and view topic-related videos on your channel.
    • Creating playlists is a great way of increasing a channel's overall view because after viewing a video YouTube will auto-play other videos in the same playlist.
    • Having an organized channel will show professionalism and increase the perceived value of your brand.
    • The first contact is usually the homepage, so it should be properly branded and organized.
    • Scheduling and Premiers keep fans engaged. This can be done by creating videos in batches and scheduling them to automatically post to your page.
    • Posting videos and subscribe links to blogs or social media pages can be a great way to gain more subscribers and video views.
